data.title: Nostalgic Plaza Theatre
data.text: I've been going to the Plaza Theatre since the early 70's  when it was called The Big G Jamboree.  Now it is used for plays, business meetings, concerts, plays, style shows, etc...  I've seen several plays here over the years and they were all great.  They also show FREE movies occasionally.  The building is very nostalgic looking from outside, and yet has been completely refurbished to Art Deco style of the 1940's era on the inside  Whatever event you choose to attend in this building will be enjoyable.

data.title: Summer youth theater
data.text: Into the Woods was a great musical play.  All of the kids did a great job!  The costumes were amazing.

data.title: Christmas with Elvis (David Allen)
data.text: My friend and I enjoyed a nice Christmas time performance with David Allen and another Elvis imitator performing.  I liked the music and enjoyed the teddy bears being thrown to the audience by Elvis and Priscilla.

data.title: What a great throwback!
data.text: I love this place, they've retooled for plays now but you can still catch free old classic movies ever now and then. It feels like stepping back in time. LOVE It!

data.title: Wonderful slice of Americana
data.text: I've attended a number of plays at this venue and loved every one. The facilities are just the right size for almost any production. We've also used it for our end of the year banquet. They also have a wonderful free movie program. It's truly a fun experience for the entire family. They also have sodas and popcorn for just $2. Great if your traveling on a budget.

data.title: Retro, comfortable venue
data.text:
This is a lovely restored early 20th century movie theatre. No balcony, but some of the original plaster work from the 30's is still there (I think). The City of Garland has also refurbished the stage and backstage, so this is a great venue for recitals, concerts & plays. 
The seats are comfortable and the restrooms have been modernized. There isn't really a concession area, just a small space with a sink & refrigerator, so don't expect a wide variety of snacks.
Approximately once a quarter, the City of Garland Parks, Recreation & Cultural Arts Department puts on a free movie. For instance, last Christmas the selection was "Holiday Inn" on a Thursday & "White Christmas" on a Saturday evening. 
I helped stage manage a revue for Veteran's Day, 2014 there. The backstage, dressing rooms, & electronics are adequate for most smaller companies to use.
The nicest part is that there are now several restaurants around the theatre so you can eat before the main attraction, then just walk around the square to your car afterwards.

data.title: Cornerstone of Downtown Garland!
data.text: Although this theater no longer shows first or second run films, it remains quite active with plays, bands,and productions from schools of all levels in GISD and the surrounding area! Shows films on special occasions like Halloween or Christmas that are either free or very reasonable! I live down the street from the Plaza and I love the Neon and the fact that it has been preserved so well! The Square in Garland would not be the same without this landmark! I grew up in the Lakewood area, and the Plaza reminds me of the Lakewood Theater and many good memories from there! Hope it never falls into disrepair or neglect, Garland would definitely suffer if that happened!

data.title: Plaza  Theatre
data.text:
An inexpensive way to enjoy live theatre
Very professional actors and great music
Comfortable seating and a good variety of plays

data.title: A Night at the Theater.
data.text: I've only been to the Plaza Theater twice, and I enjoyed each of my visits.  It's an old type of theater with lots of old fashioned appeal, that's if you like old fashioned appeal.  I watch two live performances at the Plaza by local acting talent.  Both shows were entertaining.

data.title: Not A Bad Seat in the House
data.text: Small community Theatre in downtown Garland.  Small enough that no matter where you sit you have a great seat.  Sound is Good too.  Lots of good restaurants around for dinner before or drinks after.   Lots of good shows are held here from community, to school shows, to local entertainment.

data.title: Art Deco Restoration at its best!
data.text: As a long, long, long time resident, I remember so vividly paying my QUARTER to see movies in this theater, then being heart-broken watching it sit in ruin for many years.  I was thrilled when the city got this piece of property and could not wait for them to "do something with it"!  Well it was worth the wait!  I have been to many performances here - my daughter even had her studio dance recital here a couple of times.  There is always something interesting going on here and it makes my heart happy when I get to go to a movie or performance at The Plaza!

data.title: Elvis lives!
data.text:
We went here to see an "Elvis Trubute Artist" (ETA) just to have something to do the night we spent in Garland. The show was great--David Allen surely deserves his place in the Top Ten Elvis ETA's earned in national competition. 

The theater is in a quaint old part of town. I wish we'd arrived earlier to explore the area. The theater is a good size, not tiny not huge. The inside is clean and bright. The seats were comfortable, and the audience experience was enjoyable. I'd love to see a movie here some time. 

Free street parking. We saw a live benefit performance, so I don't know the movie ticket prices.

data.title: Great shows at economical prices
data.text: The Plaza theater always offers great shows, whether live or classic movies, at great admission prices.  It's always quality, family fun.

data.title: The Plaza is Memories of a Simpler Time
data.text: It is a very nice 'arena' for Shows and Plays in a an Area that might surprise you.  But then again most people are surprised at the sophisticated and nice things they can find in Garland!!!

data.title: Super Funky
data.text: Blast from the past! This place is the iconic presence on the downtown Garland square. I think they have children's theater productions as well as local music groups, etc.

data.title: Kraig Parker & the Stamps
data.text: The concert was out of sight.  The theatre was so welcoming.  We all felt safe there.  The people were so friendly.
